text:
Sixth Avenue, south across Canal Street, showing this new extension and its subway under construction. Dominating the background is the New York Telephone Company building. This is to be included in a new structure without interruption to service. View 3 shows this constructional stage. The cupola atop the Municipal Building is to the right.

September 9, 1927
October 19, 1928
April 16, 1931

P. L. Sperr

December 7, 1927.

title: Manhattan : 6th Avenue Extension - North Canal Street.

text:
Sixth Avenue, north across Canal Street, as photographed from atop the American Thread Company Building at West Broadway and Beach Street. Shown is this new diagonal extension to the Avenue and its subway line underground. The old "El" line is at the right, running on West Broadway along the front of St. Alphonsus Roman Catholic Church.

October 17, 1928
Views 1,2,3

P. L. Sperr

Sixth Avenue, north across Canal Street, as photographed from atop the American Thread Company Building at West Broadway and Beach Street. Shown is this new diagonal extension to the Avenue and its subway line underground. The old "El" line is at the right, running on West Broadway along the front of St. Alphonsus Roman Catholic Church.

October 17, 1928
Views 1,2,3

P. L. Sperr

Sixth Avenue, north across Canal Street, as photographed from atop the American Thread Company Building at West Broadway and Beach Street. Shown is this new diagonal extension to the Avenue and its subway line underground. The old "El" line is at the right, running on West Broadway along the front of St. Alphonsus Roman Catholic Church.

October 17, 1928
Views 1,2,3

P. L. Sperr

Sixth Avenue, north across Canal Street as photographed from atop the Carborundem Building on Laight at Canal Streets. Under construction is the new Avenue extension and its municipal subway underground. This new thoroughfare in its diagonal path crosses several others; that on the left being what was formerly Sullivan Street. Thompson Street is on the right. Upon the latter abuts the rear of St. Alphonsus Roman Catholic Church.

October 18, 1928
Views 1,2,3

P. L. Sperr

Sixth Avenue, east side, north from above Canal Street, showing constructional details of this new diagonal extension and its subway underground. Grand Street is in the midground and the buildings there face on both sides of same. These extend east to Thompson Street. View 2 is photographed at Grand Street.

October 19, 1928
Views 1,2

P. L. Sperr
title: Manhattan: 6th Avenue - Canal Street - Grand Street

title: Manhattan: 6th Avenue - Canal Street - Grand Street

text:
(1) Sixth Ave. Extension, north from Canal Street, showing Varick Street on the right, with Thompson Street on the left.

March 19, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, and showing St. Alphonsus R.C. Church and Parochial School at Nos. 4-10 Thompson Street, east side, between Canal and Grand Streets.

June 3, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same as No. 1, at a later date.

October 21, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

Sixth Avenue, south across Canal Street, showing this new diagonal extension to the Avenue. Dominating the view is the New York Telephone Company Building. It occupies the plot bounded by Sixth Avenue, from Lispenard to Walker Streets, east to Church Street.
Note the old 6th Avenue "El" line running on West Broadway.
This was taken down in 1939.
View 1: March 20, 1932
View 2: May 19, 1933
P. L. Sperr

Sixth Avenue, south across Canal Street, showing this new diagonal extension to the Avenue. Dominating the view is the New York Telephone Company Building. It occupies the plot bounded by Sixth Avenue, from Lispenard to Walker Streets, east to Church Street.
Note the old 6th Avenue "El" line running on West Broadway.
This was taken down in 1939.
View 1: March 20, 1932
View 2: May 19, 1933
P. L. Sperr
